definition: unable to take one's eyes off (idiom); to gaze steadily/to stare
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)

sentences.english: He was so busy clocking her that he spilt a glass of beer over the table-cloth.
sentences.chinese: 他只顾目不转睛地盯着她，竟把一杯啤酒洒在桌布上。

sentences.english: Mr. Hunter kept his eyes nailed on the car in front of his.
sentences.chinese: 亨特先生目不转睛地盯着他的前面一辆车子。

sentences.english: She kept looking out of the window, suffused with the warmth from the fire.
sentences.chinese: 她目不转睛地望着窗外，身上洋溢着火炉的热意。

sentences.english: He sat on my vis-a-viz seat with eyes fixed on me.
sentences.chinese: 他坐在我对面的座位上，目不转睛地盯着我。

sentences.english: Do not look at me with fixed eyes like that.
sentences.chinese: 别那样目不转睛地盯着我看。

sentences.english: Dick and Jackie are all eyes at the show.
sentences.chinese: 狄克和杰克在目不转睛地看戏。

sentences.english: She glues her eyes to the show window.
sentences.chinese: 她目不转睛地盯着橱窗。

sentences.english: Bob seemed all thumbs in doing housework, and all eyes when a football match began.
sentences.chinese: 鲍伯做家务活时笨手笨脚，看起足球赛来则目不转睛。

sentences.english: David could not take his eyes off her. Jenny saw this and was delighted.
sentences.chinese: 大卫简直目不转睛也看着她，詹尼见了心里乐滋滋的。

sentences.english: At the circus the children wre all eyes.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们目不转睛地观看马戏表演。

sentences.english: Staring on Priam's wounds with her old eyes.
sentences.chinese: 向她丈夫的伤口，愕视着，目不转睛。

sentences.english: The captain standing beside him had his eyes too fixed on the cavalry below.
sentences.chinese: 大尉就站在身旁，也目不转睛地望着下面的骑兵。

sentences.english: I don't like to see children glueing their eyes to the television set for hours.
sentences.chinese: 我不喜欢见到孩子们一连几个小时目不转睛地看电视。

sentences.english: I hugged him close and gazed into his eyes.
sentences.chinese: 我抱紧他，目不转睛地看着他的眼睛。

sentences.english: The children stared at the lion, all the colour draining from their faces.
sentences.chinese: 孩子们目不转睛地盯着狮子，个个面如土色。

sentences.english: Why is the haruspex eyeballing the sheep's liver?
sentences.chinese: 为什么肠卜师目不转睛地打量那绵羊的肝脏呢？

definition: to concentrate one's attention completely (idiom)/with rapt attention
to stare/to look blank/to be fixed (of eyes)
